title: Nigel Havers breaks down as he opens up on meeting third wife Georgiana Bronfman when he 'really needed her'

Nigel Havers broke down in tears on Piers Morgan ’s Life Stories as he opened up about how his third wife Georgiana Bronfman came at a time when he really “needed” her. 
The former Coronation Street actor’s second wife Polly Williams tragically passed away from ovarian cancer in 2004, after 10 years of happy marriage. 
Speaking of his loss, Nigel said: “It was a tragic thing of course because she was determined not to die. 
“She was immensely brave but she fought it tooth and nail for years, six years. Read More Nigel Havers was on Piers Morgan's Life Stories (Photo: ITV) He teared up talking about his love life (Photo: ITV) He lost his second wife Polly to ovarian cancer (Photo: Max Mumby) 
“I gave up working for the last three because I wanted to be with her and make sure she was OK.” 
He went on to reveal the last thing she said to him, illustrating how hard a battle she fought. 
Nigel said: “I was in the hospital, it was the end really and I stroked her hair and I said, ‘Darling just relax, take it easy, just take it easy’ and she said, ‘F**k off’.” 
Nigel is now happily married to Georgiana, having got together with her soon after Polly’s death. Read More Soon after, he met Georgiana (Photo: WireImage) He feels very lucky to have found happiness again (Photo: ITV) He was so honest in the chat (Photo: ITV) 
Tearing up, he explained: “She had been single for a long time, I was fairly newly single and we just rocked on so well and I’m so happy. 
“Very happy… She is fantastic. I’m very lucky.” 
As Piers asked him what was making him so emotional, Nigel explained: “Just my luck I think and we only live once don’t we, make the most of it and I’m just having this wonderful time.”
